books: Families, Families by Suzanne Lang
Our Class is a Family by Shannon Olsen
Stella Brings the Family by Miriam Schiller
The Relatives Came by Cynthia Rylant
letters_numbers: Tracing letter U with wet/dry/try method
activities: Build My House: Create family faces with playdough
Baby Doll Bath: Pretend play with dolls
Family Pet: Shape pieces of paper to make pets
Family Puppets: Make popsicle stick puppets
Decorate a House: Use art materials to decorate a house cutout
Family Tree: Decorate a tree with family members
Doll Painting: Paint using a doll as a brush
Family Collage: Cut out magazine images for a family collage
Build a Family: Add dolls to match family size
How Many People in Family: Count family members
Family Member Ordering: Arrange family images by height
House Sort: Sort houses by numbers 1-10
sensory: Cuts, doll house people, and shovels in sensory table
raw_excerpt: Weekly theme: We Are Family. Activities include crafts like family portraits, puppets, and collages. Focus on letter U with tracing and identifying objects. Sensory table has doll house items.

Walter Had a Best Friend by Deborah Underwood

Letter T: Introduction with objects starting with T

raw_excerpt: CHICAGO CONTEMPORARY PRESCHOOL Classroom: Pre-K Week of: September 22-26 Weekly Theme: You've Got a Friend in Me. Books: Frog and Toad Are Friends by Arnold Lobel, The Rainbow Fish by Marcus Pfister, I've Got a Best Friend by Karl Edwards, Walter Had a Best Friend by Deborah Underwood, Strictly No Elephants by Lisa Mantchev. Activities: Hide and seek, friendship towers, friendship bracelets, friend portraits, handprint art, painting with shapes, friendship quilt, friend collage, fingerprint activity, Help the Doll Find His Friends game, color mixing, I Pick You Pick game, Fill the Bus with Friends. Sensory table: rice and small houses.
